intro: Lindsaea uncinella, commonly known as the hooked lindsaea, is a species of epiphytic fern native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, clustered fronds that often grow on trees or rocks. The plant has small, ovate leaves with serrated margins, and its spore-producing structures are borne on the underside of the fronds. Lindsaea uncinella is typically found in humid, shaded environments, where it thrives in the canopy of tropical forests. Its unique morphology and ecological niche make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
